text:
Anyone using Genymotion on Windows? When I first started using it, it worked great. It installed a virtual ethernet device and started right up with no problems every time. Then at some point I upgraded both Genymotion and VirtualBox and every time I launch it. I get a UAC that wants to urn VBoxSVC.exe and installs a new network adapter. I get the emulator to come up 9/10 times but the 1/10 it's an error message on how the virtualbox host couldn't be communicated with. Another side affect of these multiple virual ethernet adapters is that slack and other apps will get confused and lose their connections after launching Genymotion. 

Anyone else here have (and solve) problems like this?
did you try a clean installation?
Yes. I actually did a fresh install for Windows 10. And installed Genymotion after that and I still have this issue
i believe my genymotion wasn’t working after upgrading to windows 10, i think i reinstalled it but honestly i haven’t been using it very much
unfortunately i’m not home to try it now though
I am having very similar problems from 8.1 and 10 so I don't think it's Windows 10 itself. I wish I understood why VirtualBox thinks it needs to create a new adapter every time.
"Unexpected response code 200” really volley? unexpected success?

attachments.title: NetworkError from Volley when debuggable is set to false
attachments.text: I am trying to use MoPub for in-app advertising, which uses Volley as its HTTP networking library. Volley is throwing a NetworkError when attempting to load ads, but only when debuggable is set to ...
attachments.fallback: NetworkError from Volley when debuggable is set to false

text: wow, debuggable = true/false in build.gradle changes BuildConfig.DEBUG
I thought BuildConfig.DEBUG was whether you are running debug or release

basically my SO question solution is because i’m getting the API key for production and mopub isn’t set up properly, but I had assumed I was getting the production key when debuggable was true as well
